Dialogue.Page: TRAPPIST-1g is the sixth planet around the star TRAPPIST-1.
TRAPPIST-1f is a terrestrial planet similar in size to Earth orbiting beyond TRAPPIST-1's frost line.
Because of its low density, it is likely to contain a significant amount of water, although probably not as a liquid, at least on its surface.
It could be entirely frozen over, with the only liquid water being deep under its surface heated through tidal forces.
Or it could be covered in a steam atmosphere, heating the surface to a high temperature.
